verses.verse: Ephraim <S%H669><s%> feedeth <S%H7462><s%> on wind <S%H7307><s%>, and followeth <S%H7291><s%> after the east wind <S%H6921><s%>: he continually <S%H3117><s%> multiplieth <S%H7235><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> and desolation <S%H7701><s%>; and they make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with Assyria <S%H804><s%>, and oil <S%H8081><s%> is carried <S%H2986><s%> into Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath also a controversy <S%H7379><s%> with Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and will punish <S%H6485><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> according to his ways <S%H1870><s%>; according to his doings <S%H4611><s%> will he recompense him <S%H7725><s%>.
In the womb <S%H990><s%> he took his brother <S%H251><s%> by the heel <S%H6117><s%>; and in his manhood <S%H202><s%> he had power <S%H8280><s%> with God <S%H430><s%>:

yea <S%H7786><s%>, he had power over the angel <S%H4397><s%>, and prevailed <S%H3201><s%>; he wept <S%H1058><s%>, and made supplication <S%H2603><s%> unto him <S%H4672><s%>: he found him at Beth-el <S%H1008><s%>, and there he spake with us <S%H1696><s%>,
even Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>; Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is his memorial name <S%H2143><s%>.

Therefore turn <S%H7725><s%> thou to thy God <S%H430><s%>: keep <S%H8104><s%> kindness <S%H2617><s%> and justice <S%H4941><s%>, and wait <S%H6960><s%> for thy God <S%H430><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%>.
He is a trafficker <S%H3667><s%>, the balances <S%H3976><s%> of deceit <S%H4820><s%> are in his hand <S%H3027><s%>: he loveth <S%H157><s%> to oppress <S%H6231><s%>.

And Ephraim <S%H669><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Surely I am become rich <S%H6238><s%>, I have found me <S%H4672><s%> wealth <S%H202><s%>: in all my labors <S%H3018><s%> they shall find <S%H4672><s%> in me no iniquity <S%H5771><s%> that were sin <S%H2399><s%>.

But I am Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> from the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>; I will yet again make thee to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in tents <S%H168><s%>, as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of the solemn feast <S%H4150><s%>.

I have also spoken <S%H1696><s%> unto the prophets <S%H5030><s%>, and I have multiplied <S%H7235><s%> visions <S%H2377><s%>; and by the ministry <S%H3027><s%> of the prophets <S%H5030><s%> have I used similitudes <S%H1819><s%>.

Is Gilead <S%H1568><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%>? they are altogether false <S%H7723><s%>; in Gilgal <S%H1537><s%> they sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> bullocks <S%H7794><s%>; yea <S%H4196><s%>, their altars are as heaps <S%H1530><s%> in the furrows <S%H8525><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> into the field <S%H7704><s%> of Aram <S%H758><s%>, and Israel <S%H3478><s%> served <S%H5647><s%> for a wife <S%H802><s%>, and for a wife <S%H802><s%> he kept sheep <S%H8104><s%>.
And by a prophet <S%H5030><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> brought <S%H5927><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> up out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and by a prophet <S%H5030><s%> was he preserved <S%H8104><s%>.

Ephraim <S%H669><s%> hath provoked to anger <S%H3707><s%> most bitterly <S%H8563><s%>: therefore shall his blood <S%H1818><s%> be left <S%H5203><s%> upon him <S%H2781><s%>, and his reproach shall his Lord <S%H113><s%> return unto him <S%H7725><s%>.
